disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Have I rejected the unity of the Church when frustrated by certain aspects of its teachings or members, particularly those that relate to social justice and equality?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did I use words to belittle or mock the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Did I speak disrespectfully about the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Have I, through my actions and attitudes, dishonored my mother and father?
disobedience.description: Respecting parental authority helps maintain proper order in families and society, and that parents deserve honor for their role in giving life, nurturing, and forming their children in faith and virtue.

disobedience.question: Have I shown disrespect to my mother through my actions and attitudes?
disobedience.description: Respecting parental authority helps maintain proper order in families and society, and that parents deserve honor for their role in giving life, nurturing, and forming their children in faith and virtue.

disobedience.question: Have I through my deeds dishonored my mother?
disobedience.description: Respecting parental authority helps maintain proper order in families and society, and that parents deserve honor for their role in giving life, nurturing, and forming their children in faith and virtue.

condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did I ever encourage fellow Catholics to neglect receiving Sacraments or attending Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did I permit others to continue in error by failing to address their mistakes, even when it would have required a difficult conversation?
condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

condoning.question: Did you condone a funeral where human remains were not buried?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

condoning.question: Did I fail to advise another Catholic against marrying outside the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

extracted_data_phrases: to another Catholic marrying outside the Church through my words

condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

uncharity.question: Did I let my own desires and needs take precedence over those of others in need?
uncharity.description: This is considered sinful because excessive self-focus and selfishness violates Christ's command to love our neighbors as ourselves and contradicts the Christian call to practice charity, compassion, and self-sacrifice for others.

uncharity.question: Have I shown disrespect towards others, considering them as children of God, through my thoughts and words?
uncharity.description: Treating others with disrespect denies their inherent dignity as beings created in God's image and violates Christ's command to love one another as He has loved us.

extracted_data_phrases: especially in situations where I was feeling frustrated or overwhelmed
uncharity.question: Did I lose my patience with others, especially in situations where I was feeling frustrated or overwhelmed?
uncharity.description: Losing patience with others fails to reflect God's infinite patience with us and violates Christ's command to love our neighbor, instead allowing anger and frustration to override charity and kindness.

uncharity.question: Did I fail to stand up for someone else being treated unfairly?

uncharity.question: Did I permit others to be treated unfairly?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Have I failed to assist those who were in need of assistance?
uncharity.description: Refusing to help those in need violates Jesus's direct command to love our neighbor and practice the works of mercy, as illustrated in the parable of the Good Samaritan.

uncharity.question: Have I neglected to lend my assistance to those who were in genuine need of it?

extracted_data_phrases: especially during times of crisis or hardship

lukewarmness.question: Am I uninterested in growing spiritually?
lukewarmness.description: Lukewarmness in spiritual growth is sinful because one essentially chooses comfort and mediocrity over the transformative love God offers, which Jesus specifically warned against in Revelation 3:16.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted your own abilities and accomplishments, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the blessings in my life, assuming they were solely due to my own abilities and efforts rather than God's providence?

autonomy.question: Did you harbor thoughts that questioned God's existence?
